properties.areaDesc: Mason, WV; Putnam, WV; Jackson, WV; Cabell, WV; Gallia, OH; Meigs, OH; Lawrence, OH
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 2:48AM EST until February 13 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Gallia County in southeastern Ohio...
Southeastern Lawrence County in southeastern Ohio...
Eastern Meigs County in southeastern Ohio...
Cabell County in central West Virginia...
Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia...
Mason County in western West Virginia...
Northern Putnam County in western West Virginia...

* Until noon EST Thursday.

* At 248 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated prolonged rainfall.
Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warning
area. Between one half inch and one inch of rain has fallen and
the rain is expected to continue through the early morning hours.
Additional rainfall amounts of up to one half inch are possible
through the early morning hours.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Ripley,
Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Rio Grande, Chesapeake, Racine, Proctorville,
Forked Run State Park, Barboursville, Ravenswood, Kenova, Milton,
New Haven, Eleanor and Buffalo.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses,
as well as country roads, farmland, and other poor drainage areas
and low lying spots.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
